title: Gothic font
content:
What is this font?

comments.content:
Previous discussion:

[http://typophile.com/node/78988](http://web.archive.org/web/20150324235812/http:/typophile.com/node/78988 "http://typophile.com/node/78988")

No-one in that thread pinpointed an exact origin, but someone did make a digital version based on it.

Just to clarify, the digital font is of a second and different variation of Old English mentioned in [http://typophile.com/node/78988](http://web.archive.org/web/20150324235812/http:/typophile.com/node/78988 "http://typophile.com/node/78988"). Still no digital for these particular letters.  
The Joy Company sold iron on letters very similar to your image

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150324235812im_/http:/typophile.com/files/JoyOldEnglishTypophile116964_6239.jpg)
 Discussed at [http://typophile.com/node/116964](http://web.archive.org/web/20150324235812/http:/typophile.com/node/116964 "http://typophile.com/node/116964")  
Don
